Posts.Title: Fuming with comment from nurse in Chemo unit

Posts.Content: Yes it is nice to see you back,Shellian !! nice to read the answers on here..and .TheScriptFan...will you be my Auntie if I ever go in again?? @SnowysMum,what a fab idea.I used to ask the nurses if I could write a ffedback on their forms for re registration,as I loved saying how good they were,and as they were quite senior to me I felt very powerful!!But I would only ask if I could do it for the ones I had worked with and knew to be fab at their job.I wrote my Night Sisters’ one,(she was Staff Nurse )and she said she couldnt get thro the door.Well...theres enough dreadful things said about nurses,it is such a souldestroying task these days.When I started the patients werent like they are today...but I digress... NiceCuppa....I am so sorry you had such a bad experience....I always said every nurse should be a patient during training to get the idea of what makes a good nurse.Am so sorry you were left in tears.Maybe a different Hospital isn’t such a bad idea for you....I had a raft of different nurses during my op...I soon saw the ones I liked but as I had just come off the Wards myself...I am afraid I was a bit voluble ...I wasn’t weepy then...but Letrozole saw to that...and I have been very mush since....sorry that was a typo...but I think I will leave it...yes mush is the correct word for how I often am left feeling now....xxx I,also,don’t think you are “broken”...there must be a nearer word to how you are...maybe very very sad and feeling the hardest times of our cancer journey...But just because you feel like this doesn’t make it true. There will be a time when you will look back on this and see that it is hard,and maybe the hardest time,but that you came through it.I think when they all say,”baby steps” I think I am still learning that sometimes we can only take a day at a time....and you will get stronger.xxx
Posts.Title: Fuming with comment from nurse in Chemo unit

Posts.Content: Bless you Judith and thanks so much for taking the time to reply so fully.i am afraid that I don't understand all the technical things in your post...but generally I concur with you.Going to the gym(after much goading from my lovely twin!)has helped me immenselty.not only coz I feel more fit and less breathless on long walks(I don't have a car),I am also more confident.It was exactly the thing I needed at the time.I like the idea of your friend becoming a nutritionist...very interesting job. Another BIG advantage of regular(gentle please!)exercise,is that I slept LIKE A LOG!I also was on a food/drink regime where I became a lot healthier and submitted my diary to my PT every week.This ensured that I ate healthily,lost unnecessary weight,and also got to having less alco.yes,painful but healthy!I am now thinking of taking up boxing(gentle,and with my other arm!)as I saw someone do it at the gym and thought what a Brillo idea!Knock that cancer out! Oh,and less of the "old"as my Papa used to say,"I'm not dead yet!"loved my Papa xxx

Posts.Content: Can I just ask a question?is it possible to still get this tired a year after my DIEP with follow-up of letrozol only?i took early retirement from a very physical job,at the time,but I am only active a percentage of that time now.i do go to gym,and see my young nephew and neice once a week(soon to be twice),and do Sunday School and Church,but apart from that,and my own housework,I don't really do much at all.I feel it is strange to feel this exhausted!after a day out I find I am prostate the next day!x

Posts.Title: Protecting others

Posts.Content: Hi,HopeRU, it all sounds a bit tight and painful for you.I too had a DIEP,and was rold not to do heavy lifting or reach up high with the arm next to the affected breast.However,your physio should be trained in the correct exercises. If I were you,I would ring up your Breast cancer Nurse with all this.She is in the best position to help you. As far as the other things go,I now eat a (very,for me)healthy diet,all of a sudden,and i have noticed the changes.so,generally i should keep to lots of fresh fruit and veg and nuts,etc.Not only will this help with any residual constipation,but,I have found,it has also kick-started my immune system. At the end of the day,your breast care nurse may want you to see your Consultant.He/she will be able to see if the wound is too tight.However,you have had a massive op and and an enormoaus scar over your tummy to deal with.mine did feel tight too,but it is a lot better now.Hope this helps a little x
Posts.Title: Post–op exercises and eating following DIEP Flap reconstruction

Posts.Content: Himich78.... just to say,welcome! I agree with Leolady56 and also would like to add,that it is more common these days for GPs to send their patients for a host of investigations for whatever they see them about.Your GP is acting with integrity and safety.However,this doesn’t mean you have cancer. But if you have,he / she is dealing with it promptly and chances are,you will be treated and come out the other side well and happy,which is far more the case these days than it ever has been.I was treated 2 years ago and didnt need chemo or radiotherapy,and the cancer has been taken right away. sorry if this sounds a bit clinical,but your mind will be giving you all sorts of scenarios,but rest assured,90%of these will probably never come to fruition. stay in touch with Macmillan and talk about all your worries.there is also a phone number if you feel you wake up in the night,or just any time,need to just talk. These days treatment is so very advanced and many many people can look back and say,”it was a bit scary but I’m okay”xxx

Posts.Content: Hmmm good question... i have been on Letrozole for 2 years and looking at photos before I realised how much thicker it was. Posts.Content: Hi annamariagrogan,I was like you at work. we had a couple of other ladies had also had bc,to the shock of us all when it happened....and it was a strange but lovely thing that it gave each one of us (diagnised ladies)a sort of new respect and understanding of each other,( altho with one it would have been extremely begrudging from her side) I find it a little sinister that work so thoughtlessly produced a Presntation which appeard to blame women,and their lifestyle. of course it could be,but could also equally be harmful conditions in the workplace,I would have thought,i.e.working Nights/Days weekly for years....(health and safety issue ignored?)...Who Knows.....Because if they have done the research,Nobodiy’s Telling.(liability nightmare??...Who Knows)[more sadly ,Who Cares?] i was relatively fortunate in that I had no further treatment after my Diep,apart from letrozole and follow-up appointments. However,on a list of “hidden illnesses”which occurred for me  as a result of my Cancer and subsequent early retirement,etc etc,I am still not thro the aftermath. I wont go into them here,and I don’t want to get all bitter and twisted,etc...but somebody close to me ,a few months agter it(it was 2-3 years ago),said to me airily ,”Oh you are better from that now”. Which left me open -mouthed ..... Posts.Content: I love this thread!Iand I love those two ...was only thinking to myself this morning...is there a place in this old world for gentle artistic poetic souls....?... may I place my favourite piece which I sometimes go back to,and always love the words of....(makes me weep a little bit-esp the bit that says “everywhere life is full of heroism” Desiderata GO PLACIDLY amid the noise and the haste, and remember what peace there may be in silence. As far as possible, without surrender, be on good terms with all persons. Speak your truth quietly and clearly; and listen to others, even to the dull and the ignorant; they too have their story. Avoid loud and aggressive persons; they are vexatious to the spirit. If you compare yourself with others, you may become vain or bitter, for always there will be greater and lesser persons than yourself. Enjoy your achievements as well as your plans. Keep interested in your own career, however humble; it is a real possession in the changing fortunes of time. Exercise caution in your business affairs, for the world is full of trickery. But let this not blind you to what virtue there is; many persons strive for high ideals, and everywhere life is full of heroism. Be yourself. Especially do not feign affection. Neither be cynical about love; for in the face of all aridity and disenchantment, it is as perennial as the grass. Take kindly the counsel of the years, gracefully surrendering the things of youth. Nurture strength of spirit to shield you in sudden misfortune. But do not distress yourself with dark imaginings. Many fears are born of fatigue and loneliness. Beyond a wholesome discipline, be gentle with yourself. You are a child of the universe no less than the trees and the stars; you have a right to be here. And whether or not it is clear to you, no doubt the universe is unfolding as it should. Therefore be at peace with God, whatever you conceive Him to be. And whatever your labors and aspirations, in the noisy confusion of life, keep peace in your soul. With all its sham, drudgery and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy. By Max Ehrmann © 1927
Posts.Title: For anyone whos struggling <3

Posts.Content: Hi,youngatheart I was in same position,and was drip-fed,but in a sense I was happy not to be bombarded and (possibly)frightened by too much info.However,after a while,I did ring through to my Breast Cancer Nurse,and asked her more questions,and was relieved with her answers. you will find her number on your booklet I think,or in the info you were given at the Hospital.Failing that,just ring the Cancer Ward/ suite,where you were seen,and ask for her number and name . They have access to your own personal information and notes,so their advice will be tailor made for you. Never be afraid to ask anything...they are well trained to manage your information and your emotions (if necessary)... They may ask you to go in to see them...mine did...but sometimes will answer a quick question on the phone if they feel it will be ok. hope this helps...also you can also ring a help here on Macmillan,at the number you find on the Homepage. Xxxx

Posts.Content: Dear Hattie, My heart goes out to you,you are such a tender age!!i am glad you have somebody nice going with you.I was 59 when I had it done and I was full of fears,but I asked the staff to explain every step of the procedure to me as they went...in clear language please...and that I was a bit deaf.They were marvellous,and it was a bit funny when they spoke loudly for me for some time,as I am not that deaf...but I remember saying to my sister,it must be emotionally draining for them to concentrate like that for so long for me (a demanding patient as I saw it!)They were fab and I really didn't feel a thing!!in fact we ended up joking a bit about Polititions,as I eventually admitted I had worked for the NHS for 25 years!! Try to get your information from reliable sources,like your breast care Nurse and team.Try not to listen to people who don't know your particular diagnosis.there are always scare stories!!i had them too,and got myself into a right tizzy... Just ask any questions ,they are all so well trained xxx

Posts.Title: Feelings

Posts.Content: Hi. Well,yesterday I went for my yearly check-up since my DIEP. Everyone was very nice (except the uptight receptionist)and I think that might have made me worse.But when I came out I went into feelings of being overwhelmed. It was the first time I had been back properly and I was going thro the whole thing again.i was trying to do 3 things at once as I find it hard to travel alone to these things on public transport,and my long suffering friend was giving me a lift and I didn't want to keep her waiting or keep asking her to take me. The thing is ,last year at this time when I had my operation for cancer I sort of went through it in a sort of denial...I don't ever remember feelings of being overwhelmed. But yesterday I did,and the memories were still there,I suppose. I was taken in to see my Cosultant and she was ever so nice and I was kind of making jokes n things.but when she examined my (good)Breast it was tender and I went "ouch!ouch!"and she said would I like a mammogram?i said oh,yes please and she said she thought they could do it there and then without me having to go back. I went thro and had a consultation with my Breast nurse which was for something different. The receptionist was as curt as usual. Then she showed me thro to have my mammogram,and I said ,"the Consultant asked me to say that it is tender" She did the mammogram very gently and kept calling me "sweetheart"which I didn't mind at all in fact it helped me. Then when I came out I sort of felt really starnge and when the Nurse asked I was ok,she could tell I wasn't. So she kept trying to find me a room unsuccessfully,and I said,"it's okay I will just go back to my friend"but she was holding my hand and said,"I'm not going to let you go"as I tried to slip away. Anyway,to cut a long story short,I came home and was a bit overwhelmed. Tonight all night I have been feeling the same,and it started when I was watching the Highland midwife and saw the Nurses. I wish I could get rid of this feeling.Xx

Posts.Content: Well I am re-writing this (in precis)....I wanted to say,another benefit of my gym..(where I just popped in to for half an hour after Church)..is that the trainers are so LOVELY.I stood for a while chatting to the weekend trainer for about 15 minutes all about why I did my workout..and that led to my med history,as he asked...and he stood and listened so interested for so long...and not once did I feel aware of my body.They are so unjudgemental and are interested in you for you...thats why I love them.I have put on 2.5 stone since I was 40, and half a stone of that could be traced back to my cancer and op....I am very aware of it..and sometimes don’t go places as I have nothing to wear to hide my massiveness....but there I can just be myself xxx and wear T-shirts and show my Arms...and leggings...and nobody cares....xx ronstar...beautiful post xxx

WhatHappened...Go You!!i loved readding the tale of your walk.Immediately following my op,I couldn’t walk far without getting out of breath,which frightened me a bit as I dont have a car ...but I had an older bro and sis encouraging me to go to gym...so in the end I gave in and went.The first time I got there I had to plonk down on the handy sofa,breathless and panting!!My trainer tells me I used to do the same after each warm up exercise too... Anyway that was 9 months ago,and I am now so much fitter and less frightened as I dont get breathless now.I only do 2 half hours each week on the warm up exercises...but have kept steadily at it.The trainers are great and good fun.They laugh when I try to scare them with my “guns”.would recommend it to anyone.I used to avoid gym-type activity at all costs!!

Posts.Content: Hi,well I have not been for a walk today as I was in Sunday School with my lovely children who I love love love...it is a new thing I have been able to do since I took early retirement and have always wanted to do...not having any of my own.. I did do some dancing and clearing up...not QUITE walking but the dancing was fun...some of the moves are sign language and if I dont get them I ask the ch to show me...I know the sign for “care”now... Well,have had a brillo time !!!ahhh my li’l darlings...at one time I put my head up,and Helen,who I keep an eye out for as she is so delicate and tiny,was on the step showing everyone how to dance by kicking her legs out and knowing the moves!!(got that wrong !)and we had a craft bit where the children had to make a model of Jesus walking on the water (“why did Peter fall in?”A”because he lost his balance?”)and I found the secret every teacher knows..Delegation!,so Henry,who was doing his craft back to front,by sticking bits on before colouring them,wasn’t told off,but was awarded a pont by me for making a prototype which everyone else could copy(I often ask the children how it’s done,as I get there late,depending on a lift)and Toby (my new little gangster)came to me and told me his cousin had had an accident Involving an electric saw on his head...but it was okay coz he was praying for him....(eek!)and little Alan sat with his head covered with his hoodie and sideways to us,very quietly getting on and colouring quite beautifully...I love picking out the quiet ones for praise...there are loud ones who sing but they were happy singing...I thought My knitted knocker would fly out while we were doing the dancing ,but fortunately had anchored it inside the pocket of my mastectomy bra....xx

Posts.Content: .Hi,WhatHappened....I love reading your posts they are so nicely put...and I feel I am in the room with you!! A lot of what you say I can recognise SO well,and is so sad because it happens so much,I can tell you.I remember someone telling me that and it helped in a strange way . Maybe there might be a way where you can “introduce “your Mum again to your siblings?maybe a family fun tea out,or (and that is asking a lot with some!)a games together...something which they will all enjoy??and they can see her not as a “burden”.I am not saying this is what is happening with your family...but it does happen. Try not to nag them or make them feel guilty,they will only dig their heels in and it will be worse for you in the end,They may even turn on you a bit,through their guilt. It is tempting to go down the road(or in your case,up!)of getting all angry and bitter.That is so easy but doesnt do anyone any good in the end.Just know that you are doing your very best and you will ultimately have nothing to blame yourself for.... You have the added bonus of many more years being close to her. What is my challenge for today? hmmmm....well I have a number of jobs which tended to be put off while I was so poorly with this “bug” which need to gently be put to bed,one by ome...but the big challenge is to find a long enough slot in one day this week to go and see “Collette”.(a date with the Cinema-yes,I will dress up!!) hugs....xx

Posts.Content: well ,I have had a LOVELY DAY today...and Guess what?!!!I forgot my iphone!!so no pictures...so I cant show you the banks of wild elder beside the canal;the sitting on a post in the sunshine watching the world go by with my SECOND icecream(its been so long....,and I am,at heart a bit of a rebel!)....;crossing the River on the ferry with a grumpy ferryman who wasn’t as full f the joys of Spring as me;coming in to land near the ducks who sat there like Les Dawson doing his middle-aged ladies impression with his hands folded under his bosom(oxpccasionally lifting one,with a sour face);the light llunch I had reading my book,and moving my seat to the sun and watching the rowers row up the sunny River,through the branches of an ancient tree;the sun tinkling on the water and the willow;standing on the bridge int he sun and light breeze,nearly lifting my hat,watching the swans fly with their magnificent wing span over the boats;finding another secret garden which I can sit quietly in and read when the crowds have gone,inspecting it accidentally at the same time  as another lady who told me to feel the lovely soft spikey plants;people are so friendly if yoy let them be....it was gorgeous....and maybe all the more gorgeous because I had to store it in my memeory and just enjoy the moment.....xxx A “Singing Day”

Posts.Content: @Leolady...Hurray for “feeling more me” And @Amalie...such a gorgeous name...love the idea of the peacocks. I have a little story about peacocks . One Sunday I had come back from Church and eating my Pizza dinner (yes,sad.,I know,not a roast)..and my eye was caught by what I thoughht was a man,climbing over the garages to the flats...(seen thro net curtains).I hurried to the window,and there,strutting around my lovely David Austin David MacIntosh ancient -smelling rose,was a female peacock,eyeing me crossly.I just could nit believe my eyes!!after videoing it for future reference for a minute,I thought I would phone RSPCA.Nobody there.So I phoned Police(who else??).After some thought and silence and being passed around a bit,a woman PC came on the phone and said,”It won’t hurt you,Love”!! Aghhh!anyway...eventually found out that there is a man who keeps them a road away and had reported one lost.I can’t remember what happened in the end. Headlines???x

Posts.Content: seaspirit44...that is so funny that you are stopping to study the blossoms each time you go out!! i do that sort of thing.and the roses sound beautiful.I am not a gardener but I love looking !!I live in a shared complex where we share garden,but I managed to sneak a David Austin rose (David Macintosh)outside my window,which has done fabulously even though I havent touched it!!It has the fragrance of ancient roses and looks like a cabbage rose and is the most beautiful piNk Sorry but it makes me wax lyrical.After my Dad died the flowers in peoples gardens were a source of happiness for me.I never used to like them at all... my twin comes on Thursday.I am looking forard to it ...we will see my oldest sister too.He only comes home once every year.the night Before my DIEP I sent him a photo of me smiling ,but he could tell I was looking very worried underneath... sorry this is turning into a message all about ME,and not about “Walking back to Happiness” at all,am rather hijacking it....Anyway...am trying to gird my loins to go to gym....as I said somewhere before,I am the doormouse and he is the sporty one...he will get me walking,no doubt....he is Mr Galvanise !!! It was him who got me going to the gym...because I was breathless and fainty every time I walked to the shops before that...and it has stopped that breathlessness in its tracks... hoping evryone enjoys their walks today....loving seeing the pictures of your walks...xxxx

Posts.Content: Hiflossie...I actually had a DIEP and am happy with it...but you must make up your own mind... oh,moomy...those icecreams!!I love icecream,especially gelato. but my trainer gave me some results today from my being at the gym twice a week and low-fat, for a year.Well,I have lost 4 kg and my BMI seems to be nearly within normal guidelines.My muscle /fat ratio is so much better!! was quite proud,until he told me  he would like me to lose another 10 kg!! well,my ca meds put on weight so it is a bit of an uphill battle... but am so pleased to see the first results!!xx I must admit,after battling for a year,I do give in to the odd gelato....and really,I think that’s ok...we all need a little treat now and then xx(my friend said to me today,”Everything in moderation”,but I said...”well sometimes they are not very moderate....”x the piccie is what I came home and did with my mannequin after I had seen the lovely costumes in “Swan Lake”

Posts.Content: Thankyou flossie....it just “goes from time to time.When I was put on letrozole the Oncologist told me that it would exacerbate anything I had had before.(for the first while,anyway)Well my hip did sometimes “go” at work,but not all the time.So even tho I am not at work anymore ,it still will”go”and I feel this may be due to letrozole....altho I have been on it a long time.Last time I asked the GP if I could maybe have an x-ray to just be sure it wasn’t moderate arthritis.(before that,it had been “mild”in both hips.) Well,the x-ray showed nothing more than before really. So maybe it is inherent in taking letrozole.I ‘m not sure.But it is a nuisance as I have to walk everywhere as I don’t have a car.Just grrrrrrrrXxx

Posts.Content: Ooo,lovely,AnnJac!!! i dont know why,but I was under the impression you had been a Nurse,totally wrong as usual!!but you will be able to seemyour handiwork for years to come!! I had a fabo time,I walked along the River this morning and saw some exquisite sites in the sunlight,then went to Church and heard some exquisite singing!!was even able to blend in a bit as the choir ended their procession near to me,still singing,(I always slip in at the back!) Nice ladies talking to me and I recognised a couple from my old CE  who were really nice. Then went to their” Volunteer Fair”...so much going on there!!thought I might like drama sewing and joining the ladies group... I came away a bit overwhelmed there is so much going on there! And then I walked along the sunshiney River and to the Market. My sister was unable to take our Mums satin duvet back with her and,as it is too big for me to store,said I could donate it to a charity...sadly for us.It did comfort me when I was getting over cancer, So This week I phoned around the Charity shops and finally found one which takes second hand quilts and duvets.Acorns (Childrens Hospice charity)does,and I asked if they are used directly for the children and she said “yes,if they are in good condition” Well I took Mums Quilt along with a little note for the lady to say it was Mums and that it would be lovely if it was in good enough condition to be directly used to keep a child warm) so pleased X

Violetsniff was sniffing along the ground,one night when she came across an earwig o.”Hi o earwig,can’t you sleep either??” ”No,”said earwig o,”Dreamthief came and took all my sleep away!!” ”well,”said Violetsniff,,”have 2xAnne cc’s of this medicine and see if it helps...by the way,have you seen A Shimmering Unicorn???” ”Have you been on those mazza mushrooms again,Violetsniff?”earwig o said crossly. Posts.Content: Seaspirit...very well done for never having your hair done badly again!! after 2 years of feeling like a blob after my op,and putting on weight,I have decided to have nice clothes again.Even if they make me look a bit weird,I am just going to go for it and enjoy getting dressed up again. nothing like giving in to our feminine side from time to time ,I say!xx and please dont worry about the damselflies thingy... Seaspirithanks for asking...my gym is okay...It sounds everso sporty and cool but in fact all I do is sit on the bike with backrest reading my book!!I cycle for 25 mins,then go on the cross-trainer as trying to build up other muscles now...The activity has always been the main aim,as I gave up work 2 years ago and after my op I was everso breathless and fainty.But it soon stopped that and I felt more confident and fitter  quite soon after I started. Posts.Content: Oh!!I love trees!! you have taken me back to when I was about 8 ,moomy..lying in our local park on a beautiful day,listening to the wind rustling the very tops leaves in the tall trees,and watching the clouds...Bliss x I agree,there are lots of ways to walk back to happiness,Eddiboy...mine was into Church where I sat in the Service coz not my turn to do Sunday School,but loving seeing all the children afterwards.The Collection went past our line,as people do private giving,but I had a lil something in an envelope and wasnt sure what to do with it then...but I saw my lil Sunday School boy come up to help collecting and I gave it to him.Am so proud he does collection,although only about 5-6,and told him I was glad it was him who collected it. it is not due to me that he helps,obviously...but I love his family,and was watching his little sister(about 3) being walked by her big brother (about 4)and smiled at her,she has golden curls and I held her chin (like old ladies used to do...I do it now!!would never have thought....)cupped in my hand telling her Dad she had the face of an angel,and he said “I blame the parents”!,,Hmmmmmmm........ i may have a rather romantic sense of children ...I have never had them............ oh,and before you think I only go for nice polite pretty children...my favourite is a lil boy who keeps snakes and taratullas,who roars theough the room,and who has recently started coming to Church and is in my Sunday School.He is my secret favourite because he needs more help maybe...I gave him a big hug.,couldnt help myself....although am seriously alert to creepie crawlies...my one big thing... feel like Gladys Aylward.....but I love em xx I do feel that having to take early retirement after my DIEP gave me the chance to spend time with the SUnday School which I could never do before all my life because I worked for the NHS .....and also doing the things I love...so .....

Posts.Content: Welcome all newbies,nice to see you...xx Well,I had a LOVELY walk into town this morning and was so cheered by everybodys good moods.(I havent been in for a while,but been using my very impersonal Shoopping Centre) to begin with I cast a sad glance over at the dress shop wheich has closed overnight,where a lovely friend used to work,and always gave me a hug after my operation.... I past a lovely elderly gentleman who stopped and stood aside for me in such a wonderful gentlamanly way so nice and old fashioned,then after smiling and thanking him,I felt he wanted to say something but I was very cross with myself as I had gone by the time I realised.Then took some things into Charity shop ( I like choosing the charity ) and the girl was lovely.Then to a well - known store to order lots of £5 electric toothbrushes which I have found are fantastic for getting in deep, for Christmas presents...but dont tell anybody!!!The Manager was jolly and kept talking to the till as we were ordering.... then over to a bookshop to get some holiday books,found the assistant so very helpful and happy with his friend the other assistant,and gave me the weather forecast when asked... Then to S where I did my shopping and a nice little happy Italian man was at the till who is always so chirpy and helpful.I had given up looking for my points card and he said to take my time and actually pointed it out in my purse -of-many- pockets -and -receipts for me. Then I saw my taxi man who I did have a lil crush on,but he didnt seem interested,and got quietly into his cab,expecting a quiet journey home.In the event he was extremely chatty and said he hadnt seen me for a long time and how was I?  Etc etc....and as I got out told me to look after myself. well,for us older people,I’ll tell you what, give me my local shops,rather than Shopping Centre  anytime....and I mean it.Love them all.

Posts.Content: Hi Lovely ladies, yes I agree the NHS is so different to when I joined,too,33 years ago.In the old days you would stand up when the Nursing Officer cane in,stand up for handover...the patients were more than appreciative there was strict discipline for the right things. bit of a hobby horse for me really.However,I just want to add ....I watched my 33 year old nephew look after his little boy who had a recent high temperature recently.(yes,he is a lot better now,thankyou)...and I was SO proud of him.He sat with him,missing 2 work days,took his temperature regularly,gave him his medicine from a prescribed chart on the fridge,made sure he regularly ate and drank fluids....I was blown away.There was me thinking all young people are hopeless ....He has dyslexia and didnt do well at school,and drives for a living.I was so proud of him I told him if he ever wants to give up driving he should become a Care Assistant!!I said he was much better than some I worked with,one of whom sat at the computer all day long without fear ....but thats another story.... oh cant remember where I was going with this...and am sorry have side tracked from walking for happiness... But seeing that GP gave me such a weird feeling.Waht a waste!!I it was a bit like going into your GP and finding a taxi driver sitting there!! Anyway I have made similar choices in my career doing my SRN training successfully,then opting to be a Care Assistant again after years of private Nursing.Stress and the NHS.....hmmmm....could write a book. on to happier things....the daffs are looking tremndous and alsmost defiant of the horrid snows.my little tiny patch of garden is boasting pink,and purple hyacinths,soooooo preeeeeeeeeety....and my twin is paying a visit from other lands and he will take me out for walks,sure as eggs is eggs...it was him who galvanised me into the gym....probably saved my sanity and life as I was being Quite the coach potato....(yes hes always been the sporty one...I was always the doormaouse) sorry about story of my life ...got nobody to talk to really....Bless you for listening,love you all xxxx

Posts.Content: Ooo,great advicelindylou,about the painkiller.... sorry to butt in,but I wanted to tell you about part of my “walk back to happiness “has been becoming a Sunday School leader /helper,after having to take early retirement...and here is how it went today....”Well,I have to say,Sunday School was really ace today.As I got out of the car from my lift I could discern whose voice was the loudest coming from before Church Service.!As I walked into Church I saw a little lump behind the Curtain and it was Helen the tiny 2 year-old with blonde curls,and she smiled at me today.(afterwards her big brother who is 4 and an excellent Goalie btw,helped her going downstairs ..they are a gorgeous family.We were all to play games outside (organised)and I was put in with the bean bags.(I know my place).My first group were my own SS group and to make it more exciting I did it “boys against the girls”.The girls were really good and actually beat the boys...but it was fab to see one of my little tear -aways get the maximum of 12 and I asked him to help me score as he was good at sums and he was excellent.He won a point from me.I told them I was proud of them.The little girl who originally backchatted me,comes up to me every week now and tells me something.today it was that she could say her name in sign. the older ones were with us too today and some of the older girls( 13-14 yr olds ) were chatting with the teenys.It was lovely to see and they obviously love them.Then it got thirsty and I asked the leader if we could all have the icepops but they didnt yet so I opened my flask and gave alll the teeny ones in the shade with me a cup of water.I made sure Ann got one,,she is the little girl who has been adopted.(They say it takes a whole Village to bring up a child and I love to do my bit.)Maybe I shouldnt say this but thrre were two young men ( about 14) who were telling me their names and I didn't know them and I was playfully singing ones ‘ name (O****r) and the girls were laughing at me.Later I found out they were the Pastor’s boys.Extremely polite,but like all boys,were up to trouble and one threw his twins’ red trainer out of the window .I thought I mustn‘t let them off just ‘coz they are the Pastors boys,and so I sent one of them down,one -shoe -on -and -one -shoe -off,into the car park to get the shoes. if I could have taken a cameo of any moments,it would have been,the little girl who goes with her name,Lacey,straddled at the end of the line so tiny and not good at all at games but quietly joining in.Also one of the 14- year olds talking adoringly to the little ones.The other one,my tear -away taking responsibity well by counting the score and getting 12/12.xxx”

Posts.Content: Hey Ruby Rose,welcome!well done for the aquarobics...sounds perfect for your neuropathy,and so glad you love it.I tried it and loved for a while. nice to see you,not least because you have an eminently useable ID name !(for my stories!)ha ha . well,I walked back to happiness in a roundabout way yesterday.Went into town and asked the 2 young shop assistants (they wanted to do it together)if they could download some nice music I had chosen (to show I had voicemails etc) Well,after jigging around to thise already downloaded,complmenting me on my Minnie Mouse cover,and going into raptures about the one I had chosen,(which was quite complimentary and made me feel young),they passed it back to me and said they couldnt do it...called in another and he said It Can’t Be Done. Then spent nearly an hour in photo shop trying to download 25 photos for my hand made cards.It should have taken ten minutes but they kept wafting me aside to deal with the queue of peopl...(All I wanted was for one of them to wave their magic all-knowing finger on to the correct button on the machine-and I WAS there first!) went shopping and awarded myself a tiny icecream, Came home and after a bit of studying,and time,managed to download 4 nice tunes for different things onto my Iphone.Something which Couldn’t Be Done.xxSo yes,am very happy and feel like a success after feeling like a complete techy failure!!

Posts.Content: I only wanted to say.,,,I went to a Ladies’ Evening lastnight....and it was glorious!!LMainly because I had been lying prone with a vile migraine an hour previously,in a darkened roomwondering whether to cry off.,and it was the first time I had been,and when I got there the lights were pleasingly dimmed, and the music soft and a womans’ beautiful voice,bit like Joni Mitchell,and EVERYOBODY was smiling!!and I got swept up by two ladies,,spontaneously,and evryone was sooooo frindly after wards.It was like stepping in to Heaven!! the subject was “Women of Valour”,and the speaker was soooooooooo good. Posts.Content: WhatHappenedand HappyFeet1...and others...thankyou so much for your kind encouragement...it means a lot.yes the dimmed lights were a particular feature...and you made me smile when you said”Just for me”...wouldn’t be surprised!!I felt blessed. Leolady....your photo was so much fun and cheered me up...it was great!! WhatHappened....well Done with giving yourself credit !!and you are doing well!I so understand about your wishes that your Mum would go out.I looked after my Dad and I felt the same. Older people have all sorts of reason why they won’t,and have “come up” in a generation where they don’t speak openly as we sometimes would.it wouldnt be becoming to force them to,so sometimes we just have to “read between the lines” Not wanting to go out could be anything from ;lack of wanting to “be a burden”;fear of being alone in unknown situations (especially if they have lost a spouse);needing time to adjust to a concept of going out when they are used to living alone,etc etc. Give her time and think of small nice things she might like to do ,maybe with you.(a bit like encouraging someones appetite) Older people need longer .Old age is a funny thing,but sometimes with gentle tact and persuasion,older people can surprise us !, And yes,you have picked up on the loneliness of old people,which is something,thankfully,the government seem to be recognising.I wish more could be done in that area.—xx i have to add,sometimes I sit here and work out 2 things I will definately do when I just “dont want to”!,Then the whole day is arranged around that...like a sort of challenge. PS,I Usually find,when I make myself,I usually really enjoy it !!(Criteria....)1)It only has to be small and manageable ;2)with people I know;and 3)with smiley people though...xxx

Posts.Content: Oh!poor ladies with your sore feet affecting your walking!!what a basic thing we take for granted...walking!!hooe you can get some relief!! I will see if I can find the photo,Seaspirit....but my sister lives near to Hampton Court and so I took a Coach journey about every 2 months last year to meet her there....it was part of my recovery plan for myself...(long story,but had had a year of loneliness “eased”only by very painful regular encounters ,she had listened to me all year on the phone...and decided to prescribe myself seeing lovely people instead so prescription:meet my lovely older sister 4 times a year...bear with....) Anyway,I took the notion to dress up in a mysterious or dramtic costume with great backdrops...(as you do)As you know I am nothing if not a bit creative and eccentric!!My lovely older sister,humoured me.... So one day I dressed up as a mysterious lady with black lace mask  and black fan,(not in photo)covered by my vintage black velvet cloak.... obviously I kept most props tucked well inside my handbag on the journey!! In the event,Hampton Court was unusaully empty and we managed to find a massive room with beautiful fireplace and she took some photos of me!! it was fun...and then I found an assistant in costume and asked if I could have a picture with her....she agreed,very patiently,and I have somewhere a photo of me as I found myself approaching her from behind (not deliberate)and laughing to myself as she was dignified but looking sideways at me rather worriedly!!it was not deliberate but it was funny!!i wouldnt have embarrassed her for the world...but I suppose I needed to let my playfulness out... I will try and find the photo....xx oh dear,do you think me Very Silly??????!, yes,I am practising to be an eccentric old woman!!xx

Posts.Content: Awww,pauvre AnnJac..!!!! I feel sorry for you.That horrid old physio..they can be a bit bossy!!My first foray out of bed after my DIEP,was shared by 2 physios ...shouting at me to stand up straight...but I couldnt-I fainted!!...so dramatic!! Then I wanted my catheter to stay in longer...yes,I know,I know,..it makes you walk to the loo,when it is out,and can have infection repurcussions,and cause lack of tone for passing urine...etc etc....you know these things but hey,I even wanted one if I went flying!!How coooool is that?! (yes I was quite a rebel) in your walk dont forget the cake tin!and I hope that tender skin heals up..(oooch!sore....) I have to add HappyFeet1....that I was wearing my T shirt saying .”Scotland the Brave”.(which I wear ,when I am not feeling very brave.)I wore it when my Night Nursing Sister took me  to my first appointments when I was discovering whether I had cancer. (She offered to take me immediately she knew..) She smiled. (She is a super cool dude.)xxx ooo and like the ideas of the virtual walks..xx

Posts.Content: Hi,I Have NO Idea which thread to put this on,so I will just leave this here....(hope you don’t mind) AnnJac(..I think that was a good idea to let the air get to your wound...on my old ward there was a nurse whose Papa was n old Army Major (Doctor) who would rip off dressings on sight!(to let the air get to it”!,...ok if within a sterile atmosphere ..maybe not best in a Hospital...but hey!!)but sunshine and oxygen are meant to be good for healing I think.During my time in Hospitals all sorts of things were used....egg white,honey...etc....) yipeeee!!Sunday School today!!xx well,Sunday School was fab...Love love love it!! Pat with his sheepdog toy(who once memorably brought him back to my fold )has now a tiny dalmation...thinking hard for that spiritual significance.... We did Joshua and the walls of Jericho(quick burst of Mahalia Jackson please!)and they loved it,all except the ones who went round anti-clockewise,the ones who camped in the middle,and Sam,who was very upset that he didnt have a whoopsie to blow.and had a good hard kick of a cardboard box bit of the wall...He was a bit naughty all round today.Being  a helper,today,(as ran out of time for small groups..)I had the privilege of rounding up the strays...and after a few scuffles( where I actually separated them and moved the perpetrators- bit old- fashioned I know...but works!)and collected one (the major scuffler)writing on the blackboard at the back.He told me his Mummy was on holiday,and took my hand and he sat with me.During that time he was crying a bit saying he missed his Mummy.Oh,thank goodness I didnt tell him off too much....and I did mention that fact to the Teacher as he was knocking himself out with naughtiness today....I loved that he held my hand and told me what was wrong....and I sat him on my big seat (while I was nearly falling off sideways!!)next to me.,with my arm poised behind him so he felt warm. Afterwards I was telling the Teacher (Janet)how I love the 4-year olds,it is like in the Bible where it says “The...faces of their angels ...look on the face of God”and she said “Well mine is 12 going on 16 and a scamp.”lol.. Oh. But then one of them came up and asked for a glass of water ...Ooo!and another was Oliver Twist and said could he have some more?the best bit is where they touch your leg or something in a trusting way to ask a question...and I an getting used to them now,and they to me,i.e.I know Susuan will always sit at the back cos she doesnt like the noise,and we are ok with that.A tiny Japanese girl was marching round pd the walls and looking over with her tiny thumb up!to me...so tiny it isnt bigger than a pin.The same little girl who asked me to take her to the toilet and I was afraid she would fall in!! I could write all day about them....they are the best xx (all names changed obviously)kk

Posts.Content: Oh!Quelle Domagemoomy....too awful!! it was kind that you said it wasnt the elderly gentleman...but hey....it was a friagile lady and I am very cross on your behalf! i find it a constant pain when cyclists are on the pavement as I walk everywhere .once I saw 2 middle-aged ruddy-faced smiling ladies riding towards me,calm as you like(SIDE BY SIDE),as if they were in the middle of a  meadow inFrance!!(bit like those 1920s posters for Health and Fitness)They were on my pavement!! it happens all the time...once I had a lovely leather jacket ruined as a cyclist tore my leather sleeve as I was walking happily along minding my own business.I made a fuss but my companion (probably a Coward),said...”Oh ..Its okay.....”(“OKAY?!?!”)so much for the age of chivalry. Anyway...I am glad you ok... In good news...I took myself and my hearing aids.  To Audiology today...as I had accidentally got into the bath with them in....I was having panics thinking I would have to pay £200(see “Awake”.)but in fact...the young assistant saw them and said they were working,(as they hadnt been for me,afterwards...) I was of course sincerely grateful...but I did have a word about the last time when I lost one and had to pay £100.Apparently it is discretionary....dont get me started .....

Posts.Content: WhatHappened....thanks Hon. just to say, yes,exercise is definately “something you get into..that you actually want to go for a walk” I can attest to that!I never had a “sporty” bone in my body,and avoided exercise like the plague! But after my DIEP,I came home to find that I wasn’t at all fit,and woukd go all fainty and breathless just going to the bank!! Quelle Domage,especially since I needed to shop etc and dont have a car!! Anyway,my twin bro and older sister by email, both started nagging me to go to gym . So silly of them I thought,and also ignored them since they are suuuuch sporty types and always have been(.Far too much like hard work!!) Anyway,I started going to gym thro a scheme put on by local Surgery where they paid half your first 3 months.when I asked the GP she said “You’re not obese....”but in fact the scheme was relevant as I needed to get fit after my cancer. Some weeks they were the only people I met,and were friendly and we started to have some banter,(the trainers weren’t at all stuffy.) Then a funny thing happened...I actually started to enjoy it!!(and I did start to “get fit”(I had to go to physio at one point and my physio ,memorably ,one day was looking at my arms and said I looked “fit”,in a throw away remark.(I think he meant “fit “fit,not “fit”fit.)never been told that before!!obviously my T shirt hid some ugly secrets!!) and my breathless ness and dizzy spells eventually got better!!and whats more,I was enjoying it!! I will tell you a secret,I Read my book on the cycle quite happily ,and nobody bothers me!! And to help you,I am still,18 months later,on the warm up exercises!!....you don’t have to knock yourself out...as my PT said,it is good that I am having the activity. I think it’sthe endolphins xxxx

Posts.Content: LeoladyUnderstand levels of frustration at peak for husband...it is so the same for my older sister...her hubby who has cancer  has just got antibiots for UTI...gosh..it never seems to end for them...could cry for her...but as part of my general tidying I have found our Mum’s satin quilt,which I need to return to her as I borrowed it when I was going through such a sad time with my cancer,and also was quite cold last winter. i wrote and asked her if she would like it back as it is too large to store I found today.and she was so happy to have it back.I do hooe it will bring her some comfort now....both our parents passed many years ago.... All so busy making the most of the sunshine!!and the flowers cheered me up a treat!!AnnJac...colleagues like him are worth their weight in gold. moomy....I have been doing out my flat ,cleaning,tidying,moving furniture round.Much better than a workout this morning!! ...only to find my hoover stopped working...just as I needed it most! so,used as well as poss and ceremoniously chucked the entire thing out!!oh that felt good...it is a bit old and I cant get bags for it.Sat and ordered a new one..Getting place ready for a friend coming on Fri...upended lots of cupboards,sofa....chairs,in order to get behing sofa...then...just as I had finished for the day,got a msge saying she was cancelling. Oh flip!!I had made my cushion and stuff esp for her to sit on.... When she explained I understood.She is being what so many middle-aged ladies are being;i.e.surrogate Mum to her grandson,;looking after her Dad who has been very unwell indeed;working almost full-time on a very busy Ward.... oh I feel so sorry for her now.XXX

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much,lovely HappyFeet1...I never know if I should write about Sunday School but I do love it!never had the chance when I was care assisting...had to work weekends...but a Good Thing to come out of early retiremnet and all the rest of it..Sunday School was..... Lively! So i felt a bit like the sheepdog getting them to listen to the teacher,in the first bit...and I found out two things today,,, that Joeyhas ADHD which I suspected, And I let him and Ben draw on the blackboard as they are both a bit similar and turns out they were both listening..and Ben was good as gold snd collected up after the others.(afterwards in a talk with the teacher she said they both had ADHD.,she thinks.) (I find that as long as my children are doing something they are happy..so I always ask for their help....) There was a drama where they volunteered to be the snake, doctor, or antidote... and that was great ....(afterwards Tim told me quite happily he knows what to fo for a real snake bite as he has had them as pets and began to tell me how big they were( true)..but I managed to not let him tell me) Ben is a bit of a favourite and comes and sits on my lap at the back and Joey said he had diarrhoea,and Tim asked me” is that the Squits?”(all names changed obvS) Then then I had my own group( Reception and Year One)And..despite Simon rolling around I found they were listening to me too as I asked them a question at the end each one as they left,and Joey told me without hesitation,that Jesus is the Light of the World... So proud they took it in after all....and I know,being arty,that sometimes you can listen better when you are drawing too,etc...x

Posts.Content: WhatHappened...Oh My!it was a good job you found the lady!!She is so fortunate you were there!! Sunnyone...I like your stories about your walks.... Yesterday I was having a little break from Maccy...and my cold came back!!! So I have had it for -oh-feels like since 2018 ,now....but did go to town and did some nice things.I took a skirt back and ordered a lovely velvet top (In Sale)which I LOVE...sorry it might sound tright but nothing can cheer me like retail therapy!! Then went back to BTP (yes!it seems to be becoming a regular thing now!)looking for a doggie to pet... There was a tiny poodle under a table at the far end ...he didnt look like he wanted a pet..a bit stand-offish.,I thought..(..I admit I much prefer  big old dogs...who really look like they are old enough and have been thro so much that they appreciate a pet...)..anyway,nil desperandum,I settled on a cosy sofa and ordered a veggie burger.It came complete with lovely thin chips!!I admit it was gorgeous... Do you think doggies are like their owners?just a thought... Then I felt my cold coming back (I had thought I was bit better)and when the waitress came by asking if everything was ok,I said “Lovely but slightly draughty,sorry)..she disappeared and reappeared with ablanket !!!Oh My...I did feel coddled ...she was lovely!! I took my leave soon after...I hate to think I am passing a bad cold on...and as I was leaving I said to a (?)Manager,”Oh I just wanted to say thankyou to that waitress who gave me a blanket when I was feeling a bit cold,she was everso nice”,after he asked which one,he said,”Oh,she hasnt been nice for 4 years..”It took me a minute to realise he was joking!! Doh...I was born believeing EVRYTHING. Mama used to say,”They can see you coming”xx

Posts.Content: Well I think it is a great idea to have a self-cleaning housemoomy!As I was walking back to my flat after shopping,I saw my sr in law.I stopped and chatted and a bristley brush was sticking up out of my bag and I threatened her with it!!we laughed,but in fact I wouldnt normally do that,except I watched Danny Dyer again last night (second episode His Royal Family one)...I had seen it before bu t I was screaming laughing at the time he was imprisoned and had recounted to him the ugly death of ?Gaviston?...Normally I would turn my fine aquiline nose up at such dumbed-down nonsense...but it was Just.So.Funny!!(what do they put in the white chocolate shakes at Boston Tea Party,anyway.?) So yes I have been to BTP and indulged.I did do a lot of walking beforehand....and the assistant in there was SO nice.Oh I do like it when they are kind n stuff.I was busy looking round for a doggie to pet,as I had read online that they were dog-friendly....but...No. anyway I found a nice comfy seat and read my book,and the lady opposite me was doing her knitting in the corner,so I wished I had taken my sewing...still nil desperandum...you know how you sort of pretend to read but are really people watching?well,she was next to her Beloved,and he was on his laptop “doing some work”,but also,I perceived,People Watching.I wondered whether they had met on Tinder?They looked sort of....well.....not quite in tune.They didnt speak and I sort of was making up what was Going On.... Well,Must Dash...love V xx Yes this looks like its going to be another backwards post. LeoladyHahaha your posts made me laugh,moomy

Posts.Content: Thankyou,lovelyHappyFeet1....yes children are so charming.I love this little boy especially,I think he might have a little autism,one teacher told me,but I can’t see it(she is trained,but bit muddled,bless her,looks like Miss Marple,and Kindness Itself)...I think he is a little angel myself.What I forgot to say,in the general millieu of teaching 4-year-olds,when there is not a minute of quietness,there WAS a quiet few minutes,where they were all intent and interested in their colouring,and that was when he reached up his tiny hand and touched my hair and looked me full in the face and told me about the lesson I had been trying to teach.I mustnt show my favouritism,but I do love him.He seems naturally a good little boy,which I know is unusual!!Being a teacher yourself you will relate I am sure!!Never having been a Teacher,it is all new to me as I never had children myself. I can relate to your phone not working for the photos..exactly the same happened to me a week or two ago...and there were some Just Wonderful swan pics I could have taken...one charmer stood on her legs and reached up to full height on the pavement in front of me.Grrr ...however,it meant I just had to enjoy the moments.... today I went to Knit and Natter and it was lovely.My sewing Teacher feiend inspected my embroidery (I really value her opinion)and she said I have very neat stitches and it was beautiful.The thing is,she learnt from her Grandmother so I really respect her opinion,and it is so nice as some people just look at my work and get dead bored,really.(The Thought!!!) she herself had brought in some incredibly intensely beautiful work.She had been making a bag and making the pockets in tiny patchwork...and her stitching was incredibly tiny.I was VERY jealous.I kind of made a joke saying,”There’s always one”which the others and her laughed at as she knew I really really loved it.Huh. xxx

Posts.Content: Hi,LovelyAnnJac....so sorry your wound isn’t healing.Has anyone considered skin graft?I may be way off the mark there...am not a GP...but ....it seems so wrong that it is going in the opposite direction....it was just a thought anyway... HappyFeet1...just getting in the water is nice it diesnt matter really if your cossie bit tight.I was never a “sporty” type...but my twin bro and sister persuaded me to get excercise and it is true that is does make you feel good,and also after a while I found that I actually WANTED to do it....a-m-azing.... thankyou for asking...have been sorting a few ugly things out a bit,which have been happening,and had a pretty dire week last week,but lovelySeaspiritwas asking and I thought I would come back in and say Hi. My big bro has been having full body scan and head scan and biopsies and lots been going on with him and I was a very scared for him to be honest...I was finding it hard to keep my end up here. Lovely to see you all again and your lobely photos....Xxxxx

Posts.Content: Ooo ronstar...dare you to pretend to be the girl in the ad!!what fun! moomy...yes,it is amazing how quickly the steps/miles tot up.You seem to be very fit indeed! thankyou for the tree photo,It is lovely...HappyFeet1I will return my favourite tree of the week for you!it has such a beautiful white bark...silver birch? my favourite tree is the Magnolia,AnnJac...I used to wait each spring for the one in the house on the corner,to bloom,when my Dad was alive.He always was the first one to see the blossom in Spring.I have a feeling it only blooms for a very short time.I am afraid I am not a gardener.... my best happy walk back to happiness today was across Church to ask a new Mum if I might please hold her tiny newborn baby?? oh he was so sweet,and teeny,and as I rocked him my headache went away...hmmm,unusual analgesia! Happy Mothers Day to all you Mums...Xxxx

Posts.Content: Hi,sorry been having a lil break..but nice to see the camellia and hear about the lil doggies!  I upturned my wardrobe today to find things and clear out a bit(!)and that was a workout in itself by time moved furniture etc... so settled down with my good book and coffee, and all of a sudden my doorbell went and it was my new friend from Church,she is an elderly teacher(was).I dashed around to tidy but she said not to... and i was so pleased I had done a good bit of housework already tjis week!  We had a good long chat and I gave her some choccy biccies to take home as she liked them so much!  I think she has made it her one-man mission to visit the single ladies in Church from what she was saying! She is so sweet. she noticed all my hand made houses on top of my cupboard and lots of things which people never notice. She is so interested and interesting!  We like the same people at Ch and we chatted for ages on things from the Taj Mahal,to reading etc .,And she said she thought I had a gift with chikdren(aww how nice) well my walk back to happiness today was... talking rather a lot!! Xx

Posts.Content: (....continued from last post )..had waliked 700000 miles(7.5km) and my hip was killing me  and I was pretty “done in” and I wanted to order some things but couldnt stand to do it!  I needed to see The items and have help to order as am hopeless with that sort of things.anyway the assistant was sooooo kind and sat me on a ( John Lewis) sofa and came and sat by me and went and got the items for mE to view and helped me order(took at least half an hour) it was only a lamp and some spesh shamppoo) but the lamp had tp be “copper or rose-gold coloured”and go wiith the existing style of my lil flaHe smiled a little at my patriculars, but was SO helpful and I ordered the things and said thankyou for their extreme kindness.Then I asked if I could use the loo and they sent me to the Diisabled Loo( on the same floor.couldnt climb stairs or use lift) and I said I dont have a spesh key.. but they said thats ok... so when I got there, it was licked with no visible handle,so I thought “ oh maybI have to yank it” so I kept trying and this voice inside grumpily yelled that there was a man in there!! Ooooo heck..i dont ususally use one so didnt reLise he was locked from inside!! So I went anD lost myself in the store so he wouldnt see me when he came out!! In end i did find a nice loo at The Randolph where I had a gorgeous moktail, being served in a mesmerisingly dlow way by a nice french waiter.It was worth it!! Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thanks AnnJac...hope you are having a lovely day too.Well,I was invited by a very old friend to her Church in a town about 12 miles away today!For a wonder,the bus was working,and I go there but,trying to be clever,thought “I will get off the bus early and go a short cut”...unfortunately...I got lost...so here am I ,a little wayfarer carrying a poppy which I saw on the edge of the road ,the 2-3 miles I had to walk!! Anyway,nearly at her house,I passed a little old lady in an Easter Bonnet,and later I saw her in the Church.It was so sweet,she got up out of her pew and picked up a little red amiral which had come to a halt in the middle of the aisle!she rescued it.Then we went for the bread and wine and I stood next to a “Guide Dog for the Blind”and his owner.Oh it was all so very sweet and pretty.Then I went back with her to her house where she had invited two more people who lived on their own,and it was JUst Lovely.It was a real feast.David (who couldnt remember me,but I did him)asked me to make a hand-made card and was bowled over when I said yes,and the other lady who was 90,held court,(She was 90 but felt 60 and I was the other way round!)I dont usually tell people about my op and sunsquent retirement inless they ask. Anyway we had the most fabo time.I love my froiend so much for inviting us.Old friends are the best!!Anyway,here are one or two photos...

Posts.Content: Ooo!HappyFeet1....I love it!”a dither of ducklings”!! And Amalie....just loving the look of your nettle and wild garlic soup!!so clever. The Continued Saga of Violetsniffs’ Hip (which only hurt when I went up stairs today...and so rarely use it but have it in my bag just in case) sorry to go on about my hip...but I have a telescopic walking stick (pretty one)which is just slightly too low for me.I have seen one in the local key-makers shop and every time I go past I go and have another look.It isn’t telescopic though.So today I took my courage in bith hands (Courage!Mon Brave!)and went in and asked the enormous muscle man behind the counter if he could do me a big favour?I explained that I loved his stick but that I needed it to be telescopic,and I produced mine.I pointed out that I wasnt strong enough to move the button on the top to make it higher for me.He had a go,and I said,”if you cant do it nobody can”in a friendly way,At which point his boss moved from behind his counter and came to help him.Between them they managed it,”gasket “ and all,and I said,”Oh Bless you,thankyou,!!”and I asked what I owed them.They both kindly waived away any thought of monetry gain.I almost skipped out of the shop saying,”Oh!there are some good people left in the world!”and thanking them effusively. It might not seem like much but I have nobody to ask really and I just saw the assistants’ brawny arms.It really is worth asking! xx

Posts.Content: Well,I finally have been out after being holed up for 2 days...and went outside to have a look what’s what.the majestic weather has left pretty snow drifts in the garden.went to Polish shop and was laughing so much with the assistant who i like about this parsnip.bit like a french ballet dancer....just needs a tutu.(hope its not rude,is it?) I think it might even have a DIEP scar....(i deleted it ) ......got lots of 2p pieces so watch out mrsox  anyway...my young friend who will remain nameless ,was stuck on the M62last night and I and a lot of others were trying to help her with updates etc all night....she just found it hilarious(!)she had no food or water or blankets and didnt need to make the journey) I must be getting old or something...I was soooooooo worried for her,anyway,woke up this morn to see her eating a big pizza for breakfast....she had taken shelter in the Community Hall we told her about and got to her destination somehow by train...So drama averted...we were praying hard for her !!xx

Posts.Content: AnnJac...sorry only just read your post...I can totally empathise as when I tried to make an appointment post-Surgery to havemy dressings done and looked at..there was such a looooong wait...and I was “Hang on a minute,have worked 33 years for NHS and here I am with cancer and you wont see me?” Very selfish I know..and to discuss drugs and ongoing support is SO Importamt...you dont realise how long the queues have become ...but I also know it isn’t their fault........Oh Sunnyone...that is such a beautiful quote “In the woods between the worlds”...it sounds like it describes being discharged perfectly. WhatHappened...Hi nice to see you again...and I just realised what your ID name means...so fab!!...yes I said last night I think our cancer experiences are like PTSD....and I completely agree with your description of being”discharged” Leolady...my symapthies go out to you...I wish I could say something to help you...i keep reading to get a better understanding .... Well Knit n Natter (or “Natting’as someones husband called it)was fabo again today.The time just goes so quickly,and I was next to G who is a sewer in her own right (we both prefer sewing to knitting)and tutors people or has in the past.I took my delicate sewing and was telling her all the stitches I was doing and finishing off invisibly...just showing off really,as her Grandmother taught her and she would of course have known it all before I was born!!It is so nice to meet somebody who appreciates it though.She loved my silks and antique french ribbon which I took to show her,and then she was rooting in my bag to see my old lace n stuff.Gish I felt like the Queen.Everyone knows so well how to knit there,and are so good..and the G said she was just learning how to do “blackberry stitch”and I squeeled I can do that!!SOBeside myself with excitement cos there was something she didnt know which I did!! Everyone talks non-stop and I try to outdo them in glamour,but never do,but it is fun trying!!!! So nice to have somewhere to get dressed up for... I love it there and F says the ladies ask where I am when I can’t go!!How lovely!!

Posts.Content: Aww Sunnyone...she sounds full of wisdom and positivity...glad you have had a nice long chat....sometimes it is nice just to have things acknowledged. AnnJac....such different experiences for you...yes,keep hold of the nurse who cleaned you up and gave you fresh dressings.!! and it wasn’t your faiult re dressings before..you were only doing what you had been told.... I just wanted to say... have looked up my “ steps” for today... and I think it might be fibbing.Turns out I have done a kilometre more than yesterdaty when I walked to my bros house!! I know I went to gym but it was in the locker so ...it cant have picked me up on the bike... Otherwise I just went for a quick walk round shops.... curiouser and curioser...I went back to the Cat Cafe today as I had a booking to use up,and it was so sweet sitting by Tibbles...well,he sat besdie me and I was scrunched in the corner to be fair so that I didnt wake him up.... came home after shopping and gym,to a nice Pink Himalaya Salt soak in the bath and lots of smellies. here is a picture of Tibbles:

Posts.Content: Well,you are making bold steps to get out and about,AnnJac..despite such unhappy setbacks...so comendable.People ordinarily who are able just don’t get how hard it can be to just get from a to b.You only understand that when you suddenly have such difficulties. loving the fact you are enjoying your birds,Seaspirit...and what serendipity to find an Art Gallery! moomy...you have found some lovely flowers.Did you catch “Springwatch” tonight...they were talking a lot about birdsong.They reckoned the blackbird had the best all round song,and I tend to agree.Such a pretty sound.There was a very friendly blackbird who used to sit on a branch near the back door of the Hospital when I used to work nights and sing happily.They are such underrated birds and I think they are my favourite at the mo.They are so friendly and sing at dusk and at dawn. WhatHappened....thankyou...yes Mr Goose was inside a bubble.There was a man by the River blowing bubbles out of an enormous triangular contraption on Sunday....somehow that one looked sort of gold at the edges...

Posts.Content: Yes,HappyFeet1Anthony Gormley does get about!I love that he did those figures in Leith Water,may try and see them when I am in Edinburgh...and so glad you didnt get blown off the Pier,, Loving”WillWonka”AnnJacyou are a hero! well done with your walking moomy....I clocked up 9km today...against my better judgement!!Totally whacked at the end of it though...won’t be doing that again in a hurry!! well I am in Canterbury today. .....am in a Gothic Hotel and the Manager looks like “Lurch” from the Adams family!! But I can stretch out my head from the window into a little private space full of wilderness and wild wysteria.(as opposed to wild hysteria)... Today we went to Canterbury Cathedral and heard all about Thomas A Becket,and went in to the crypt.The choir was rehearing as we were there and it was so beautifully atmospheric.Then we came back up into the open air again and it was lovely to see the children playing on the grass and the birds singing from a flowered tower. I might find that photo to send you,Xxx ( sorry ,due to little local techy difficulty,can’t send ones from Cathedral,but here is the view from my window anway...and a pretty house we saw at Chilham today Xxx

Posts.Content: Hi,lovely duckies,ronstar...would make a great black-and-white arty shot!! like moomy,I walked 4.5 km yesterday,just to get a kitchen fan! You dont realise how far you are ambling!Then went to gym...felt like I had had a good workout when got back!!it seemed to help my sleep,too,incidentally... had a good run watching England play footie last night...vicariously you understand!(have a twin bro so have many and varied interests!) also doing a lil embroidery for Knit n Natter...there is a lady there who has taught sewing and I love her to bits (although she scares me a bit!)she was bought up by her Granny who was always sewing so she has a great handle on correct stitchery!!thats why I always show her my sewing ...she blanched a bit when I told her I cut up a dress to make the latest cushion for my cousin(don’t worry,it was from the bargain bin in Brighton and was too small )who is v trendy and sent me a birds Nest!(I thought it was a hat!and went a bit crazy on fb saying “Look what my cousin made me!a hat!”until she quitly told me no-it’s a birds’ Nest....she said it was really nice that there is someone else in the family who likes making things...I wholeheartedly agree..wondered if I was adopted more than once!!

Posts.Content: Hi,Leolady!lovely to have you galloping back!!looking forward to hearing your adventures... Amalie...you are clever,I wouldnt even try the rubix Cube...altho my nephew does it but I rather wonder sometimes if he has a blank one and sticks the colours on....is it possible to do it in a few minutes??he does... will write about my morning and then put up my star(cropped) photo from my walk to and fom Church,...yes,a Grandstanding Goose!!... Gold thread. Yes it has only taken me half an hour but it is downloaded now....................

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi NickiS, I had a DIEP and it has improved my self confidence.I did not have an expander,but I did have mastectomy+reconstructive surgery.i didn't realise I had an option not to!but anyway,I had a rather large bust prior to this operation,which was getting in my way rather.i don't mean to be trite,but it really was humongous.the surgery put well paid to that and now I have two neat smaller breasts and feel a lot less self conscious.i was told at the time that radiotherapy could be harmful to certain implants,incidentally...but just ask the question tomorrow. Your husband sounds really kind and supportive.whatever you choose to go with,I really hope you a happy outcome . PS.My Surgery did leave me a little lop-sided,but I have been told I can have further Surgery now,to correct this,which I might plump for. PPs I didn't have to have radiotherapy or chemo,so my case may be different to yours. I am not a specialist in this area and it is best to ask all questions to your BCN nurse and Cancer team hope all goes ok xx

Posts.Title: re breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi232pookie....I was very interested to read your post.I,too suffer with finding words and often have to ask ...last week I took some mincepies for the friends who take me to choir,and I had to ask the young person next to me what they were called!! It does seem to be gradually worsening and I am everso interested to see what others write in answer to your question.I am on Letrozole and had my DIEP 2 and a half years ago,but no chemo. I do ”Picturewits” crosswords which I do every night,mainly because I have enjoyed them since before I had cancer. I have sleep problems and at those times it seems worse,but I will keep an eye  on that.They include me being awake until ,say,4 or 5 in the mornings and then sleeping in.I do have to limit my time on Ipad at night etc which seems to exaccerbate this. However these times last for a week or so at a time and then recover.I put it down to doing Nights and Days in the same week when I worked,and I still think that was very unhealthy but we had no choice. I have mentioned it to a GP,who seemed in a hurry with me and said all sorts of things can cause it,not least stress. i think I will to back and see a different GP who has time to look at all my meds etc.I did feel a bit narked as I had waited an hour to see her and it didnt seem thta important to her. But hey,we all have that to deal with... So,yes,thankyou for bringing it up. Letrozole is blamed for lots of things,but I must’nt forget it is a little lifesaver too. Just wish I could get to the bottom of all this.I am 62 xxx
Posts.Title: memory and speech

Posts.Content: Hi Nicole279....its nice that you feel you can chat on here. I agree with all that rubyrosesays,there is always someone at Macmillan to talk with...also your breast cancer nurse.They are trained to deal with emotional things. i just wanted to say that I was the same and couldnt cry.I remember coming on here and asking if I was normal!! we are all so different.I think I went into sort of denial,and wouldn’t talk to anybody about it until my sister came,and then I remember looking at her like a rabbit caught in the headlights,as I was looking to her for help really. I suppose some people do keep it all to themselves,and I was a past master at this,for various reasons. But its all over and I am through the other side now.I must say this is a very special place where you can make lots of friends and talk about whatever is troubling you. love,Violetsiff x

Posts.Content: Hi,I was watching Cold Feet last night,and I confess I love it,on a superficial level....sorry to those who dont like it...but I havent had the experiences some on here have,and can only speak for myself... (.I was actually wondering while watching it,if anybody would start a thread.) I was only half watching it really,while doing something else...but I loved (and hated-if thats possible?)the way the woman with cancer (?Jenny)said that she was tired of seeing faces which were all sad and caring...although I reallise it is so normal to present this..I found myself wanting to relieve friends and family of their neeed to be sad and caring...sort of thing....Not sure how to put it really... .and well,I was a little uncomfortable with the way the anaesthtic made her hilarious...does that ever really happen?...and it jarred a little with me... all of that part of the story was a little unreal for me,and tended to downplay the need we all have for deep care at that time... But I too,loved the bit with the man who had cancer in the Car Park who took her space...that was very tender.In fact that episode made me bit weepy but in a good way.....xx

Posts.Content: Dear Sosad2019....sosad to read all of your post. I couldnt work out whether you meant to say that your sister Can’t go because “she lives so far away”? Firstly,try everso hard to try to see the wood for the trees. Secondly,Private care isn’t necessarily better than NHS care..take it from One Who Knows.NHS workers are so fantastic,and I have seen private care being rather tendered out to poor service for the best price,etc etc.(don’t get me started..!) Having said that,You may get the opposite...it was a rather blanket statement...but ...and private may or may not be faster...sorry,not sure there,but you have a point. My brother,who is abroad,and fortunately has a very good job,went private for his hip replacement,and had absolutely zilch aftercare,leaving me worrying about possible post-op complications etc and chewing my nails.But maybe that was cos it was abroad... I am having a similar situation with my older sister as her husband has skin cancer with secondaries ,and are with NHS..and I feel so helpless.It has to be said,they have good and bad experiences.. It is so hard when a loved one has cancer ,but so very hard when we feel helpless to help.XX

Posts.Content: Please dont mind me having a little indulgence...but... The Most Beautiful Thing I heard All Year..... I heard Canon Andrew speak this year and I must record the beautiful thing he said. Some of the children in the country where he works had been asked to renounce Jesus and they refused.I won’t go into the dreadful thing that happened To them then.But afterwards a little child had a vision and it was God their Father sitting in Heaven and all those litle children dancing round Him.xxJust dancing round Him ️ it is so beautiful it makes me cryxx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: ....this is so lovely,it makes me cry a little bit.... ”If” If you can keep your head when all about you Are losing theirs and blaming it on you; If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you, But make allowance for their doubting too: If you can wait and not be tired by waiting, Or, being lied about, don't deal in lies, Or being hated don't give way to hating, And yet don't look too good, nor talk too wise; If you can dream- -and not make dreams your master; If you can think- -and not make thoughts your aim, If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster And treat those two impostors just the same:. If you can bear to hear the truth you've spoken Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools, Or watch the things you gave your life to, broken, And stoop and build'em up with worn-out tools; If you can make one heap of all your winnings And risk it on one turn of pitch-and-toss, And lose, and start again at your beginnings, And never breathe a word about your loss: If you can force your heart and nerve and sinew To serve your turn long after they are gone, And so hold on when there is nothing in you Except the Will which says to them: 'Hold on! ' If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue, Or walk with Kings- -nor lose the common touch, If neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you, If all men count with you, but none too much: If you can fill the unforgiving minute With sixty seconds' worth of distance run, Yours is the Earth and everything that's in it, And- -which is more- -you'll be a Man, my son! Rudyard Kipling

Posts.Content: hi,last week I went to see my GP about a shoulder injury and also to say I was a little scared that I could feel a small lump in my breast,I thouhgt.Well,for the previous 2days it seemed to have gone,or at least decresed to a pinhead,and siince thne I cant find anything there at all,after daily checks.The GP couldnt find anything either.or any lymph node involvement.I have had a scare before when I have gone thro the whole,going to the clinic,having ultrsound,etc,,to find there was nothing to worry about.it isnt easy any more for me to travel there.My question is,should I still go?It already brouht up anxieties for me as it reminded me of the first time when something was found,nearly two years ago,and I had a DIEP.I think I have nothing there and it was just one of those random lumpy areas which come and are sore but then go again,after my operation...and I am worried I am taking up an emergency appointment someone who actually has a lump should have.I really cant find anything there at all now.
